item.title: Union Calls for Ubisoft Strike Tomorrow Following New Plan
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft announced a major overhaul plan today, and workers at the video game behemoth are not talking it well.

The reorganization calls for the cancellation of 6 projects, the delay of 7 others, and perhaps most notably for this story, an additional cost cutting of 200m Euros over the next two years, and they are implementing "acceleration of cost reduction initiatives to rightsize the organization", a phrasing that almost always means layoffs. 

One of France's biggest unions, Solidares Informatique is calling for a half-day strike at Ubisoft Paris tomorrow morning. In their post they call the reorganization plan "disastrous announcements" citing the cost-cutting plan, cancellation of projects, and end of remote working. They also issued demands for what they want for the employees:

  • The end of the cost-cutting plan,
  • Maintaining and extending the teleworking conditions,
  • Decent pay raises this year.

They go onto state that this is merely their initial reaction, and that they are discussing other strikes, presumably for longer periods or at other Ubisoft studios in France.

It is out of the question to let a boss run wild and destroy our working conditions. Perhaps we need to remind him that it is his employees who make the games.

This is the latest bit of difficulty for Ubisoft who is attempting to rebuild following some difficult fiscal periods. Only a couple days ago former Assassin's Creed boss Marc-Alexis Côté announced he was suing Ubisoft for over $1.3m following his 'constructive dismissal', which caused him to leave the company in October of 2025. 

That was tied to their organization into 'creative houses' which seems to have been partially done to get investment in Vantage Studios, which will be managing Ubisoft's largest three IPs: Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six. Ubisoft has also recently closed its Halifax studio after it organized into a union, and announced more layoffs at Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm last week.

A longtime lover of speculative fiction, in almost all its forms, Don joined TechRaptor in 2014 on a whim sending in an application as he was looking for… More about Don

item.title: Star Trek Adventures Species Sourcebook Brings New Perspectives to Your Starfleet Crew
item.content:encoded:
Modiphius Entertainment has announced a new expansion for its licensed Star Trek TTRPG. The new Star Trek Adventures Species sourcebook provides players with information about some of the most iconic alien races in the iconic sci-fi universe.

The Star Trek Adventures Species Sourcebook Announcement

In an official press release, Modiphius states that the Star Trek Adventures Species sourcebook will allow players and gamemasters to populate their main crew and supporting cast with different alien races. This will include new player options, allowing characters from any department to use species templates, deepening their gameplay experience.

This 132-page sourcebook will contain the following:

  • 60 New alien species templates. These templates include summary, traits, attribute modifiers, and other relevant details
  • Over 120 species talents. These talents can be adapted and used with other Star Trek Adventures species or used to build original alien races at your table
  • Guidance and mechanics for creating your own original alien species
  • Additional rules on how to play different alien species. Examples include androids, holograms, liberated Borg, characters from the Mirror Universe, and Vau N'Akat

If you enjoy the solo experience or haven't gotten into the latest edition, the Star Trek Adventures Species sourcebook is compatible with first edition and the Captain's Log solo mode. Wanted to run a ship as a Breen or a Brikar, but don't have the new core rulebook? No worries.

The Star Trek Adventures Species sourcebook announcement this year coincides with Star Trek's 60th anniversary. The enduring sci-fi franchise, created by Gene Roddenberry, is a franchise near and dear to many nerds' hearts. This is thanks to its intellectual, progressive look at the future, breaking several significant cultural barriers, and memorable sci-fi alien races and organizations.

The Star Trek Adventures Species sourcebook is available for pre-order now on Modiphius' webstore. It is currently available at an MSRP of $54.77 not including shipping. The book will ship in April.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler
